data.text: Participate in the 2020 IMF-World Bank Annual Meetings from anywhere in the world. Check the livestream schedule, add to your calendar and join the conversation using #IMFmeetings. https://t.co/p2Ih5CAr8h https://t.co/mj6cTckvSL

With government debt at record highs, new IMF staff research finds the framework to restructure government debt held by private creditors needs an update. Read the paper https://t.co/AgMar70rgn https://t.co/VViNMcKZaY
Creditors should provide speedy and deep debt relief to countries that need it #IMFBlog https://t.co/bgZhQP3mu2 https://t.co/eTHtuAG0Pb

The pandemic has revealed large divisions and is likely to increase disparities. @JosephEStiglitz writes in the new issue of F&D that we need a comprehensive rewriting of the rules of the economy. https://t.co/kDAfsMXoi4 https://t.co/2DyyaqYfBv

How can we use big data to #fightcorruption? A team by @DFID_UK & @GovTranspInst presents its plans to create a dashboard to expose corruption in public procurement at the #IMFinnovation #anticorruption challenge 🎦➡️ https://t.co/3sotPF04GV
More info: https://t.co/rBuAi9Izuj https://t.co/b1x4cynNTl

Thank you @AdamPosen and @PIIE for this timely conversation on rising global debt and its impact on low-income and emerging economies. https://t.co/mnNxSwVmj8 
https://t.co/RIhiooMuqY https://t.co/gBtPVi1waV https://t.co/Rnc8dmH9ga https://t.co/KLCyGhmlhy
The rules governing debt restructuring urgently need reform #IMFBlog https://t.co/bgZhQP3mu2 https://t.co/CqLOD0woXe

LIVE now: Rising global debt is a risk for countries, particularly emerging markets and low-income developing economies.  Join First Deputy Managing Director @gswokamoto and IMF colleagues @PIIE #ResolvingSovereignDebt https://t.co/h4CuK0IWNE https://t.co/MIYBkyTHpW
Sign up for our special 7-day briefing to help guide you through our 2020 Annual Meetings—pointing to all of the key publications, live events and more. https://t.co/ikwrlNZ18L #IMFmeetings

IMF Executive Board Approves 27-month US$6.5 billion Extended Fund Facility for #Ecuador. 

Read the press release: https://t.co/NLVD2F56wE
IMF staff research adds to growing evidence that the gap between rich and poor can impact the effectiveness of monetary policy. #IMFBlog https://t.co/gPKwboAtqf https://t.co/1UPbWQ7AvF

New IMF research shows that increasing public spending on #education, #health, and #social_protection and improving their efficiency could reduce #poverty and #inequality, boost #literacy, and lower mortality rates across the #MiddleEast and #NorthAfrica. https://t.co/D4tZNkEdmP https://t.co/HcoP4tjDbK

New IMF staff research asks whether income #inequality should affect how central banks conduct monetary policy. The results: There are reasons to consider inequality when setting policy. #IMFBlog https://t.co/kNYXy7bosa https://t.co/vczNx2e9Ng

Join us Oct 7th at 10:15 AM EDT for the #IMFinnovation #AntiCorruption pitch by team @TransparencyEst
as they reveal how to detect conflicts of interest in public procurement before they happen.
🎦➡️ https://t.co/8arpN2xMHq
More info ➡️  https://t.co/8zS8ZUtY2O https://t.co/6DAS1vUwGF

Live Now: IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva at the High-Level Event on Enhancing Access to Opportunities in Arab Countries, organized jointly by #G20SaudiArabia and @IMFNews https://t.co/eLiIMcz2AU

IMF Managing Director Kristalina @KGeorgieva will participate today at the High-Level Event on Enhancing Access to Opportunities in Arab Countries, organized jointly by #G20SaudiArabia and IMF. Watch here https://t.co/eLiIMcz2AU https://t.co/d4CYB5FTLF

Countries in the #MiddleEast and #CentralAsia made notable progress in social indicators such as life expectancy. But progress has been slowing, and more is needed to catch up to global peers. Read our report https://t.co/D4tZNkEdmP https://t.co/8Hd7M23gqz

The 2020 Annual Meetings of the IMF and World Bank will be held virtually this year to ensure the health and safety of participants and staff given health concerns around the COVID-19 virus. 
Follow the virtual events and use #IMFmeetings to join us! https://t.co/9PO0IixYJq https://t.co/hI90VbFXNV
What is the IMF doing to help countries during the COVID-19 crisis? Follow us to be informed. https://t.co/a5KrAWjvnb https://t.co/SqSee2x00y

Promoting the economic empowerment of #women is not only right, it is the smart thing to do. https://t.co/IdSCaPVYb5

Follow us to learn the latest research on #IMFGender https://t.co/ysCkawBTRQ
IMF Managing Director @Kgeorgieva during her conversation with Barron’s @reshmakapadia on “The Wealth Gap: A Global Perspective.” https://t.co/Y4z2sXNYS7

People in #MiddleEast and #CentralAsia would benefit from higher and more efficient spending on #health, #education, and #social_protection. Read more at #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/pdDnrjIPvs https://t.co/7D405eqORW
Remarks by @KGeorgieva at the #UNGA Meeting of Heads of State and Government ‘Financing for Development in the Era of COVID-19 and Beyond’ https://t.co/Mon46qb7vQ #GlobalGoals https://t.co/59jmUKVOSN

A 10 % increase in #social_spending per capita—if sustained for three years—could close 20–40 percent of the gap in the Human Development Index between #MiddleEast and #NorthAfrican countries and their comparators. Read our report https://t.co/D4tZNkEdmP https://t.co/HV5bNmktkC

In #MiddleEast and #CentralAsia, higher and more efficient #social_spending can significantly improve people’s lives and help promote #inclusive_growth. Find out more at #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/pdDnrjIPvs https://t.co/TrKBb2Yocs

Higher and more efficient spending on #health, #education and #social_protection can significantly improve socioeconomic outcomes such as life expectancy and help promote #inclusive_growth in the #MiddleEast and #CentralAsia. Read our report  https://t.co/D4tZNkEdmP https://t.co/IL9yclTLQo

Live now: Virtual panel on the role of social spending (health, education, social protection) in promoting inclusive growth in the Middle East., North Africa and Central Asia. #MENA #CCA https://t.co/EEbd4L2QMH

Stay Tuned for a virtual panel event today at 8.30 am (EDT) on the role of social spending (health, education, social protection) in promoting inclusive growth in the Middle East., North Africa and Central Asia. #MENA #CCA https://t.co/EEbd4L2QMH

STARTING NOW: @KGeorgieva joins @AntonioGuterres, @JustinTrudeau, @AndrewHolnessJM and other world leaders to discuss financing the #SDGs in the era of COVID-19 and beyond. #Fin4Dev #GlobalGoals https://t.co/6RiOnRVPwF

When we #SaveTheElephants, we save the planet from #climatechange. The African forest elephant provides over $150 billion in carbon-capture services, write IMF’s Ralph Chami in a new F&D article. https://t.co/kELmBsa266 https://t.co/0nmNKeItX2

Central, Eastern, & Southeastern Europe lags far behind the more advanced #European countries in the quantity & quality of its infrastructure. New #IMFCountryFocus finds that closing just 50% of this gap by 2030 would cost between 3-8% of GDP per year. https://t.co/BJFApyKRwF https://t.co/ZbmtOn3nEd

⏰📽️STARTING NOW: @KGeorgieva joins EU Energy Commissioner @KadriSimson, Estonian President @KerstiKaljulaid and @FredKempe to discuss opportunities for infrastructure investment in Central, Eastern, & Southeastern Europe. #ThreeSeas https://t.co/ybCzQW0V9W

Join us from Sept. 28 to Oct. 9 for the virtual @IMFNews & @WorldBank Civil Society Policy Forum to discuss debt #climate #corruption #gender #inequality and other issues. Full program here: https://t.co/eyEYIzLLiw #IMFmeetings https://t.co/njQj6ihioq

How to get rid of corruption when it comes to paying government employees in fragile states? On Oct 7th, a team from @IMFNews / @EY_US / Ministry of Finance of Guinea-Bissau shows how they plan to use blockchain technology.
🎦➡️ https://t.co/4uzOzUHnu8
https://t.co/Agt5WaxAgk https://t.co/ZlY0MHguf3

The latest IMF #WeekendRead newsletter focuses on global inequality, tax policy, climate change, Latin America's outlook, the #debt pandemic, the secret work of elephants and much more. Read and subscribe for weekly updates ➡️ https://t.co/qPPO5RK1kR https://t.co/OfkCfsYCcP

Is high public debt cause for alarm? As governments around the world are taking on debt at levels surpassing those during World War II, some governments will be in a better position to sustain their debt than others. https://t.co/4z8lrvghjL https://t.co/UqEUPWOyHE

Many people in the #MiddleEastNorthAfrica with access to broadband do not use the internet—a phenom called the digital usage gap.  And it turns out lack of internet access is only one part of the problem. #IMFBlog https://t.co/0S34oaIXzW https://t.co/ZNCkxekkiz

Why is it important to maintain debt at sustainable levels? And what can borrowers and creditors do to address rising debt vulnerabilities and maintain debt sustainability? Find out in this video from the IMF and read more at: https://t.co/l82kj4QEsN https://t.co/IEKlAkQpI3

Is raising tax revenues in fragile states “mission impossible”? Not according to new IMF staff research, which looks at inspirational achievements from the recent past #IMFBlog https://t.co/9odpfn69KR https://t.co/rKBFnentL9

Narrowing the #VATgap-the difference btwn the VAT collected and what could be raised w/ better design & compliance-offers the prospect of additional revenue: up to 3.5% of GDP for some low-income developing countries if they caught up to the levels of revenue collected by peers. https://t.co/YRW6eqlWYL

The IMF’s Gaspar discussed the role of the VAT in the post-COVID recovery during our first VAT webinar series event financed by the Resource Mobilization Thematic Fund. https://t.co/ZppyUVK9Yg

Until #COVID19, #Bangladesh’s economy had been experiencing robust growth. But the crisis has dealt an economic blow. New IMF emergency financing will help #Bangladesh with recovery, including spending needs on health and social protection. Read more: https://t.co/uFii1rbjCX https://t.co/61gQQMekBy

https://t.co/0twUveAR9C https://t.co/De7fVOUUvq

Did you know the African forest elephant provides over $150 billion in carbon-capture services? IMF’s Ralph Chami writes in a new F&D article that when we #SaveTheElephants, we save the planet from #climatechange. https://t.co/kELmBsa266 https://t.co/jfUvhxb67t

Did you know small and mid-sized firms make up over 90% of the businesses in the #MiddleEastNorthAfrica? Find out how new digital solutions can help them during #COVID19 #IMFBlog https://t.co/0S34oaIXzW https://t.co/6Oke2bZ4OP

Our latest research shows that digital finance is associated with higher GDP growth and financial #inclusion. It could therefore play an important role in mitigating the economic and social impact of the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/BIL0DdPFtn #fintech

Income inequality leads to pervasive inequities in access to education, healthcare, and finance. It also hampers the quality and quantity of economic growth. https://t.co/xisXkJg7fA https://t.co/kg1pchI7ru

Deputy Managing Director Antoinette Sayeh on #COVID19 in #Africa: "We have an opportunity today to put in place measures that promote an inclusive, green and smart recovery. Securing a return to ‘normal’ is not enough." @TheAfricaReport https://t.co/IKw0JPuSAm
Angola: Confronting the COVID-19 Pandemic and the Oil Price Shock. https://t.co/JlE2zrJHah #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/s3pZXdy2ob

IMF’s Zhang @ #ICSD2020: Govts or intl institutions alone cannot address the magnitude of the global challenges before us—whether development or #climate. To reach #Agenda2030, we should mobilize others, including private investors and civil society. https://t.co/vDZ2H0Wbes https://t.co/ryL8hkPkyp

IMF’s Zhang at #ICSD2020 w/ @JeffDSachs: Achieving #Agenda2030 in low-income developing countries—facing falling exports, capital outflows, remittances, and less tourism during the #COVID19 crisis—requires international support & cooperation. https://t.co/vDZ2H0Wbes https://t.co/lcecYhiIPC
REPLAY: A discussion on adapting to climate change in sub-Saharan Africa. #ClimateAction #IMFAfrica https://t.co/onAnopGuyH

#Inequality in many countries has gone up over the last decade prior to #COVID19. On the latest @EQUALSHope podcast, @KGeorgieva talks to @Oxfam about inequality, taxation, #debt, climate change, and how we can work toward a fairer and greener world. ➡️ https://t.co/PeXpefR1HO

Start your week with the latest IMF #WeekendRead newsletter, where we dive into climate change in Europe and Africa, how trade can be a tool of recovery, how the pandemic has impacted migrants and remittances, race in economics and more. ➡️ https://t.co/9vVLy3TQNb https://t.co/iKzH0tgOc9

In less than four months, billions of dollars have been disbursed to over one-third of our member countries. This 90 second milestone video, reveals how we are meeting the #COVID19 challenge, and how much we have to give. https://t.co/ahowlEjAOF https://t.co/WElfFrrfyd

Trade can be a tool for efficient recovery. A study of years’ worth of firm-level data shows trade is a potent tool for limiting how much companies can charge consumers above their costs in #subSaharanAfrica and beyond. #ChartOfTheWeek #IMFBlog https://t.co/3gmbXcoRN1 https://t.co/qmm6VPaHEV

#SubSaharanAfrica is highly impacted by climate shocks. That’s why policies to empower people, strengthen infrastructure and improve coping mechanisms must be central to building forward better from the #COVID19 crisis. #IMFBlog https://t.co/B858uOCOyM https://t.co/mJLYCeGHvM

#Inequality in many countries has gone up over the last decade prior to #COVID19. On the latest @EQUALSHope podcast, @KGeorgieva talks to @Oxfam about inequality, taxation, debt, #climatechange, and how we can work toward a fairer & greener world. ⬇️ https://t.co/WaZp2cjgXR
https://t.co/Dqsfg8RQM6

#Remittances—the money which overseas workers send back home—are a crucial source of funding for many low-income families.  Against the background of the pandemic, the need for that money is acute. https://t.co/8gNqMyLtJL #COVID19 #IMFBlog https://t.co/VWx3IVLZCj

During the current economic downturn triggered by the #pandemic, the IMF has provided financial assistance, mainly through emergency lending and precautionary lending tools, to about 80 countries. More in the latest #IMFBlog https://t.co/CXERyN6hfL #COVID19

How do we heal the fractures of the #globaleconomy and build a resilient future?  This issue of the IMF's magazine—Finance & Development—gives voice to diverse contributors on what needs to be done.
https://t.co/raKOmwQkVM https://t.co/iBgEXSjPTN

The #COVID19 crisis is testing the #worklifebalance for working mothers. A survey of workers in #Japan shows women are willing to trade off more of their salary for time at home. #IMFBlog https://t.co/2Sj3DL65ih https://t.co/Ufh04Z9tqt
